definitions.text: someone regarded as certain to succeed
examples: he's a natural for the job

definitions.text: a notation cancelling a previous sharp or flat
(craps) a first roll of 7 or 11 that immediately wins the stake
in accordance with nature; relating to or concerning nature
existing in or produced by nature; not artificial or imitation
existing in or in conformity with nature or the observable world; neither supernatural nor magical
functioning or occurring in a normal way; lacking abnormalities or deficiencies
examples: it's the natural thing to happen
a grandparent's natural affection for a grandchild

definitions.text: (of a musical note) being neither raised nor lowered by one chromatic semitone
unthinking; prompted by (or as if by) instinct
examples: a cat's natural aversion to water
offering to help was as instinctive as breathing

definitions.text: (used especially of commodities) being unprocessed or manufactured using only simple or minimal processes
